definition: to cause (something) to move by pulling or drawing : to exert traction on
to obtain or move by or as if by hauling
examples: was hauled to parties night after night by his wife

definition: to transport in a vehicle : cart
examples: The cattle were hauled to market.

definition: to change the course of (a ship) especially so as to sail closer to the wind
to bring before an authority for interrogation or judgment : hale

examples: about three o'clock we hauled into Moonridge
the bull hauled back for another lunge
haul ass or you'll miss your flight

definition: the act or process of hauling (see haul entry 1) : pull
examples: The rope stood up under the strain of the haul.

definition: a device for pulling or carting something : a device for hauling
the result of an effort to obtain, collect, or win
the quantity of fish taken in a single draft of a net
the act or process of transporting something in a vehicle : transportation by hauling
examples: a rail haul meant that several hundred expensive … cars would have to be bought

definition: the length or course of a transportation route
